>>33857624
Sleep deprivation.

I was working in an incredibly stressful and abusive job. It affected me so badly that I stopped sleeping.
At one point, I became so incredibly stressed that I started averaging about 3 hours of sleep per night.
I'm pretty sure it caused permanent brain damage, and I was SEVERELY fucked up. I'd give you a list, but my comment would be too long.

The worst bit was the hallucinations. After a few weeks of this bullshit, I started losing my fucking mind.

The shop I worked in was full of silver metal clothing racks. When I entered the store in the morning or left at night, I would frequently see shadows darting amongst the clothing. I would also see reflections in the silver, darting about. The shop counter was in the centre of the room, and I was CONSTANTLY whipping my head around because I saw movement out of the corner of my eye, like some terrible shadow was slowly creeping up on me.

Behind the shop counter, we kept a black rubbish bag, and it scared the shit out of me multiple times a day. I would be leaning against the counter, absolutely exhausted, and suddenly, out of the corner of my eye, I would spot a horrifying shadow man, curled up in a ball at my feet and staring up at me.
I can't express how terrifying that was. His closeness. His silence. His staring.
I would jolt away in panic before realising that it was just the fucking trash bag... again.
Shit - I would turn the corner and prepare myself for the black mass, and my heart would still do a little somersault when I saw it, because by this point, my brain was automatically afraid whenever I saw it.

I also had sleep paralysis most nights. Still, NONE of this was the worst bit.

1/2

The worst bit was the man with a backwards head.

>Be me, had a particularly bad sleep last night, and a particularly long shift that day
>Sitting at the very back of the bus, heading home
>It's a sunny afternoon.
>The bus is full of noisy people
>Normally I dislike crowded buses but today, I'm glad for the crowd. I'm nodding off people-watching is a good way to keep myself conscious.
>I people-watch for a few minutes.
>Then a man gets on the bus, and I forget about everything else.
>I am utterly captivated by him
>The man sits right at the front of the bus, in that weird alcove where two sets of seats are facing each other (two seats facing forwards, and two seats facing backwards).
>He sits in one of the forward-facing seats, with his back to me, and I am utterly entranced by his hair
>It's so beautiful.
>Glossy
>Matte
>Long
>Short
>Wavy
>Straight
Wait, what?
>I realise that my brain is kind of slipping, and I decide to focus on something else to regain my focus
>I look down at the man's neck and shoulders instead
>And I am fucking terrified
>Because his body is facing me, but his head is facing away from me.
HIS HEAD IS ON BACKWARDS
>And somehow I know, in the pit of my stomach, that this entire time that I was watching him, he was somehow watching ME.
>I jolt violently with fright
>The man is gone
>The bus is empty
>All is silent
>The sun is shining and I shiver.
>My hands are shaking and when I get off at my stop 2 minutes later, I tear up from fright, and keep looking behind me, in case the man with the black hair and backwards head is creeping up behind me.
>That night, I go straight to bed and sleep for 40 hours straight. When I wake up, I sleep some more.

I dunno, it's such a lame story, but I still feel sick thinking about that man.

There's a damn good reason sleep deprivation is considered 'torture'. It really is.

I've had 2, both dream-related, they are both scary in different ways, so I'll just explain both. Let me give you little context first, I'm basically the kind of guy who almost never dreams, once or twice a month at max, but its pretty irregular, sometimes I've been years without dreaming, sometimes I have 2 or 3 in a (relatively) short time, then nothing for a long time; this comes with a catch, most, if not all of them are lucid, some more than others (as in I have more freedom of action). Crazy stuff, anon. The interesting thing is that you didn't just see a trope. Most people would see a body facing forward with head backwards, staring at me, spooOOooOOky, for horror story appeal. You saw something novel and weird and that makes it kinda believable. You think it was just a hallucination?

I've got a sleep disorder and pushed my self similarly for a job. 1-3 hours a night for weeks in a row, with some full nights interspersed. Toward the end, I fortunately didn't get to your stage of visual hallucinations, but I did see lights flashing in the periphery and I heard vague voices shouting with an echo. That was when I quit my job and slept for two weeks and got a diagnosis.

I'm thinking of that sleep experiment creepy pasta; one of the results of the experiment was that sleep deprivation puts a person into the control of a different part of the brain that is usually controlled, perhaps by sleeping. Maybe the weird stuff that we perceive isn't just hallucinations, but perception of some other things that our brain usually can't notice or filters.

i got lost on a back desert road in the middle of the arizona desert at about 11pm on a road trip with an ex girlfriend. no phone service, but still had the maps route pre loaded on my phone. it was narrow thin dark oil road. first hunch was native american reservation (i later did some research on the area and found i in fact was on 'sacred ground' for whatever thats worth.

its a long story and ive considered green texting it since someone wrote about skinwalkers taking the shape of orbs of light (some old story i read a while back that i perceive as true as it was anti climactic AND i experienced the same thing)

to sum it up - lost on back road because of apple maps. long road for about an hour. then turned into a smaller more narrow road.. i then passed through a large gate, but a fuckced up gate. like it was made out of petrified wood and had animal bones tied around it and a strip of barbwire across the top. the fence posts marking the gate were at least 9 ft high. as the road got rockier i got more scared but kept my cool. internally. i had never been more scared in my life and was certain i was going to die. my girlfriend was 18 and i was 24 so do the math. i saw a lot of wildlife up until i turned onto this second road then there was nothing. while the road got rockier and more barren (if you were in a 2020 rubicon jeep you would be concerned and i was in a fuckin hatchback sport 90's shit dual sport grandma car) i stopped and told my girlfriend i HAD to check the tires to make sure they were good and she started freaking out.

as i got out of the car. it was silent. and i mean, that greentext story type of silent. not a peep. nothing. silence so loud i wouldve preferred a nuclear bomb. in the distance i saw 2 headlights coming right towards me and got very scared. i was more worried about seeing another person out here instead of a monster. as the lights neared about 50 yards or so they split off into 2. as if it was 2 motorcycles. - 1/2

here i was even more terrified and was ready to see anything. i then pulled in front of a ranch gate. it was tied shut with barb wire. i exited the car to undo the gate. it was shockingly silent again. then out of nowhere on the other side of the gate. a semi truck plowed past. about 10 yards past the gate on an embankment. there was the highway.

it was JUST like one of those movies where the main character isnt paying attention and the bus zooms by? it was terrifying.

there was some very strange circumstances that led to this detour i was on that included a cop pulling me over prior and making sure i had got a full tank of gas prior to continuing my trip.

i keep the story relatively private to people because it isnt too climactic. but its like, dude if youre in that situation. when youre out there where you dont belong. you dont need to see anything to know youre close to evil. but yea, only time in my life i was certain i was going to die. my ex girlfriend and i are still friends but have never talked bout it lol

look into vocoders
>The human voice consists of sounds generated by the opening and closing of the glottis by the vocal cords, which produces a periodic waveform with many harmonics. This basic sound is then filtered by the nose and throat (a complicated resonant piping system) to produce differences in harmonic content (formants) in a controlled way, creating the wide variety of sounds used in speech. There is another set of sounds, known as the unvoiced and plosive sounds, which are created or modified by the mouth in different fashions.

>The vocoder examines speech by measuring how its spectral characteristics change over time. This results in a series of signals representing these frequencies at any particular time as the user speaks. In simple terms, the signal is split into a number of frequency bands (the larger this number, the more accurate the analysis) and the level of signal present at each frequency band gives the instantaneous representation of the spectral energy content. To recreate speech, the vocoder simply reverses the process, processing a broadband noise source by passing it through a stage that filters the frequency content based on the originally recorded series of numbers.

>Specifically, in the encoder, the input is passed through a multiband filter, then the output of each band is measured using an envelope follower, and the signals from the envelope followers are transmitted to the decoder. The decoder applies these as control signals to corresponding amplifiers of the output filter channels.

>>33872152
They did know the existence of each other, and the the different megalithic sites that we see today as ancient ruins are just a small fragment of an Ice Age global civilization. Humans created these things, but they did it while being guided by other species who were far more connected to the divine than we are. Those beings wanted to impart upon us how important geometry was to the structure of this reality, much like a loving caretaker might encourage a child to play with blocks.

Think of it this way: humans were once guided to behave a certain way and to get in touch with the divine a certain way. This is why we see pyramids all around the globe. Eventually, those guides agreed to let us go our own way; to let humans guide other humans. It has been a struggle and we have experienced great suffering because of misguided leaders. But look around at how much we've accomplished in the time since the pyramids. We are beings of light and dark and sometimes that is hard to deal with. Yet we're doing it, little by little. We're still in a kind of rebellious teenager phase, and much of our immaturity is evident in how difficult it is to take care of ourselves and each other.

Once we can face ourselves as we really are, and every human being is taught about light and dark again, I think the old guides will return. Not to guide us again, but to welcome us as family.

The thunder bird is a really cool mythical creature. Though I've never seen one and don't believe they are real I find them fascinating anyways so hears some info about them.
The thunder bird a a mythological being from several native Indian cultures from the Pacific Northwest through the great plains and even the great lakes. So in mythology the thunder bird is not just some large eagle but a spiritual being of great important embodying power and strength. In is believed to be the upper world. The underworld is controlled by the Great Horned Serpent. Thunder bird creates thunder with it's wings and lightning from it's eyes. Is uses these to fend off under world creatures like the underwater panter. To many this was a terrifying but benevolent creature. The Ho-Chunk believed that a man who has a vision of a thunderbird during a solitary fast will become a war chief of the people

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Daoism generally advocates for non-violence and emphasizes the importance of living in harmony with nature. The Dao De Jing, one of the main texts of Daoism, states that "the soft and yielding overcomes the hard and strong." This idea is often interpreted to mean that violence is not necessary or effective in achieving one's goals. Instead, Daoism suggests that the best way to achieve balance and harmony is through peaceful means, such as compromise, negotiation, and understanding.

However, it is worth noting that Daoism is a diverse tradition, and there are different interpretations of its teachings. Some Daoist texts and practices, such as martial arts, do involve the use of physical force, but it is often understood that this is for self-defense or for achieving balance and harmony in a specific situation, rather than for causing harm or violence.

In general, Daoism emphasizes the importance of living in harmony with the natural world and the Dao and encourages individuals to find inner peace and balance through practices such as meditation, self-reflection, and understanding the interconnectedness of all things. Violence is not seen as necessary or consistent with the values and principles of Daoism.

The normative significance of a number like 18 is derived from it representing something: equivalently: A stop sign that works because the word 'stop' is printed on it.

>Can anyone project/shift/have an out of body experience?
Yes.

>Is it not just a vivid lucid dream?
No. A full successful astral projection/shift/oobe feels just as, and often even more real than the waking reality you're experiencing right now. The difference between this and even extremely vivid lucid dreams is absolutely huge.

>Does it have to be difficult and take me months/years to attain this ability?
No, it does not, the only barrier is your mind - both conscious and subconscious. If you think it's going to be difficult, it will. Many people can be successful within their first few tries.

>How come? And how is even this connected to astral travel?
There exists an infinite amount of realities with infinite "you's" into which you can focus your conscious awareness. Astral projection and other OOBEs are, in essence, the same thing - projecting your consciousness into the Astral Plane etc.

>Do I have to come back?
Not from shifting.
Yes from projecting, but also somewhat up for debate.

>Does this have anything to do with the teenager trend spreading on TikTok and in other places?
Yes and no. Kids latching onto an idea they may not even understand, pay them no attention.

>any advice on breaking through the stage im stuck on
Most powerful technique is to manipulate your subconscious mind through denial of desires. For example, make it a point that you'll eat no more food until you astral project, once you finally AP you can eat again. You could also do this with sexual gratification, internet, water, anything that has powerful urges connected to it, you deny that desire and tell yourself the only way to get what you want is to astral project. The point is creating as much stress as possible within the subconscious, resulting in powerful subconscious motivation to AP, which is especially important because it's highly probable that right now you're subconsciously resistant to AP.

What techniques you use in combination with this isn't super important, it's only important that you practice them as often as possible. What's most likely going to happen is you're going to fall asleep at some point during this process and your subconscious will do the work for you, you'll wake up right into the mind awake body asleep/vibratory stage and that's when the work you've put towards practicing separation will be most useful

>>33820441
Body asleep, mind awake.

Lay down, almost like you're about to fall asleep. Get into to a comfortable position. Next, close your eyes and keep your mind awake while your body drifts asleep.

The key part about keeping your mind awake is this: it doesn't mean staying alert. Body asleep. Mind awake. Sit back, and relax. Don't think too hard, let thoughts come to you. You will be laying down on your bed, and the thoughts will come to you bubbling into your mind. Let them grow. Look at them, focus on them. Eventually, images, and sounds will form. Peer into those. Walk into it, as if you were walking with your body.

And there you have it!

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
We gather in these generals to discuss our experiences, memories, and connection with Mother Lilith, as well as give other anons who are interested or would like to learn more about Her information or advice.

>Practices or rituals associated with Lilith?
This differs from person to person, but common approaches include giving energy to one of her sigils, chanting her enn, working with sexual spirits, doing what you think she would do, making offerings of incense/chocolate/tea, or simply praying.
While some people might feel the most comfortable engaging with her in a worshipful manner, blind faith is discouraged. It's always important to think and make decisions for oneself, and as such, Lilith guides us to understand things for ourselves.

>Books
- Liber Lilith by Donald Tyberson: https://www.pdfdrive.com/liber-lilith-a-gnostic-grimoire-e185231845.html
A Gnostic Grimoire and Novel. Beware that this book is rather dark, and some have mentioned attracting unwanted attention by reading it.
- Embracing Lilith by Mark H Williams: No PDF available online, but it's worth the price of admission.
Split into three sections, it covers accounts of working with the Goddess and her place in history, a fictional account of her origins written from her perspective, and a Grimoire.
- Lilith: Dark Feminine Archetype by Asenath Mason: https://pdfcoffee.com/lilith-dark-feminine-archetype-2-pdf-free.html
This one is a collection of writings by various peoples, with a brief but fairly thorough history at the beginning. There's a lot of random poetry in there; not useful for an occultist, but decent for an admirer.
- Lilith: Goddess of Sitra Ahra: https://zeitenundformen.files.wordpress.com/2014/01/lilith-goddess-of-sitra-ahrab-t-p.pdf
Contains a ton of aspects with associated variety of sigils.

>Videos
https://youtu.be/n1EKccz4fS0
https://youtu.be/01guwJbp_ug
https://youtu.be/75bnMRPRiDk
https://youtu.be/EHol9LrpWks

Here’s the thing - sexuality per se needn’t be bad. But most spiritual paths rely on training your awareness to let go of the material world in order to comprehend the spiritual plane. You see this everywhere - from Plato’s Allegory of the Cave, to early Christian ascetism, to the core principles of Buddhism, and in the writings of many of the most famous mystics. Most people’s sexuality is driven by lust for things on the material plane and therefore hinder this. You have three options. You can either seek an alternative path to comprehension of spiritual reality (Crowley seems like a good modern example of someone who tried to do this). Or you can go the traditional route and renounce your physical desires. Or you can decide that you’re quite happy with your sexual desires on the material plane, and that you don’t mind not pursuing ascension on the spiritual plane in this lifetime. I’m of the belief that that last option is not a bad one for most people, as long as they still follow objective morality. Not everyone needs to or can become a holy man or a wizard. But if you do want to go down that route, you need some answer to how you will deal with your sexual urges.

>>33876147
Mussolini did say that, and it's usually libertarians posting it, not commies, but Mussolini wasn't talking about LLCs lol. The tern corporation in Italian Fascist economics refers to basically a syndicate, like from Syndicalism. The way it was supposed to work is that each industry would have a corporation which would represent workers and businessmen in that industry and their disputes would be mediated by the state. It's retarded even in theory, since it obviously gives a much stronger hand to owners than workers and could create an economy with competing syndicates (for example what happens if the wheat syndicate gets mad at the fishing syndicate?). And it wasn't ever actually implemented, it was mostly rhetoric to try to make Fascism look pro-worker. The main dude in the PNF who kept pushing for its implementation, Rossoni, got retired from politics by Mussolini. But it wasn't just talking about public-private partnerships in general, it was a much more specific scheme that came from National Syndicalism and at least in theory the state would've retained final say over the economy under corporatism, even if Mussolini was a cuck for the economic elite in practice.
